titles.title: Dǝrsanä mädḫane ʿaläm “Homily on the Saviour of the World” / Mäṣḥaf lä-täzkarä mädḫane ʿaläm “Book for the Commemoration of the Saviour of the World” / Mälkǝʾa mädḫane ʿaläm “Image of the Saviour of the World”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dǝrsanä mädḫane ʿaläm “Homily on the Saviour of the World” (fols. 3ra-13ra l.7) II) Mäṣḥaf lä-täzkarä mädḫane ʿaläm “Book for the Commemoration of the Saviour of the World” (fols. 13ra l.8-72ra l.11): II-1) Introduction (fols. 13ra l.8-15ra l.5) II-2) Gädlä Täklä Maryam “Vita of Täklä Maryam (Mäbʿa Ṣǝyon)” (fols. 15ra l.7-72ra l.3) II-3) About the devotion of Täklä Maryam to the commemoration of the Saviour of the World (täzkarä Mädḫǝn) (fols. 38rb l.7-41ra l.15) (cf. EMML 3420, fol. 194b) II-4) About the reward for those who observe the commemoration of the Saviour of the World (fols. 41ra l.15-42vb) (cf. EMML 3420, fol. 197a) II-5) How Täklä Maryam brought many souls from Hell by the order of the Child Jesus who appeared to him (fols. 31ra l.10-32ra l.20) (cf. EMML 3420, fol. 198a) II-6) How Christ promised to Täklä Maryam that He would release 500 souls from the hell on the day of the commemoration of the Saviour of the World (fols. 50vb l.14-54ra l.2) (cf. EMML 4829, fol. 65b) II-7) Vision of Täklä Maryam about the life of saints in Heaven (fols. 54ra l.2-58rb) (cf. EMML 3420, fol. 206b) II-8) Vision of Täklä Maryam concerning the moon that came down from heaven (fols. 58va-61vb) (cf. EMML 4829, fol. 59b) II-9) Miracles of the Saviour of the World worked by ʾabunä Täklä Maryam (fols. 62ra-72ra l.3): II-9.1) How the saint healed a child with a swollen throat (fols. 62ra-62vb l.12) (cf. EMML 3420, fol. 192b) II-9.2) How the saint healed a sick child who was near death (fols. 62vb l.13-64rb l.4) (cf. EMML 3420, fol. 193a) II-9.3) About light that appeared over the dough from which the bread for the commemoration of the Saviour of the World was made (fols. 64rb l.4-64vb) (cf. EMML 1779, fol. 71b) II-9.4) How ʾabunä Täklä Maryam healed a barren woman (fols.65ra-66ra l.9) (cf. EMML 4829, fol. 72b) II-9.5) How pieces of bread for the commemoration of the Saviour of the World turned into the icon of Virgin Mary with her beloved Child (fols.66ra l.10-66vb l.15) (cf. EMML 4810, fol. 80b; EMML 4817, fol. 65a) II-9.6) About a man who ate the bread for the commemoration of the Saviour of the World after he ate another bread (fols. 66vb l.16-68ra l.8) (cf. EMML 3420, fol. 193b) II-9.7) About a ruler who met a recluse in a cave while campaigning against the Agäw (fols. 68ra l.9-72ra l.3) (cf. EMML 4829, fol. 76b) II-9.8) Dǝrsanä mädḫane ʿaläm, continuation (fol. 72ra l.4-l.11) III) Mälkǝʾa mädḫane ʿaläm “Image of the Saviour of the World” (fols.72ra l.14-79vb l.2).
Additio 1.

donors.donor: The names of the donors are written in the supplication formulas: Wäldä Śǝllase (e.g., fols. 8va, 15ra, 30ra, 38rb, 43ra, 50vb, 58rb), Wäldä Gäbrǝʾel (fols. 12vb-13ra, 54ra), Ḫaylä Maryam (fols. 13rb-14va, 36ra), Wälättä Giyorgis (fols. 17vb-18ra, 31rb, 41ra, 64rb, 72ra), Wälättä ʾƎgziʾ (fols. 22vb, 37rb), Wälättä Libanos (fol. 26rb).

txstates.txstate: The back board is cracked and repaired with a cord and metal staples. The sewing on the second pair of sewing stations is partly missing. A hole is carefully amended in fol. 43.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bnothers.bnother: Two rows of small holes are visible on the spine folds of the quires.

squires.squire: A(2/fol. 1r-2v) – ፩I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – ፪II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – ፫III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – ፬IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – ፭V(8/fols. 35r-42v) – ፮VI(6/fols. 43r-50v) – ፯VII(6/fols. 51r-58v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 59r-66v) – ፱IX(8/fols. 67r-74v) – ፲X(6/fols. 75r-80v).

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rulings.ruling: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. Structural pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The script tends to square forms.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donors; 1st, 2nd, 15th and 16th line in the incipit page of Text I; 1st and 3rd line of the incipit of Text II; one or two initial lines of the sections of Text I; the words ሰላም and ስብሐት in Text II; some words in Text II; elements of punctuation signs; Ethiopic numbers and elements of Ethiopic numbers. The names of the donors are rubricated in vivid crimson.

otherdetails.otherdetail: Text I-2) is an Introduction to the Vita of Täklä Maryam (cf. MKL-007, fols. 5r-6rb l.16).

additional.cont: Fol. 79vb: Donation note.
additional.add: Fol. 79vb: ዘወሀቦ፡ ለታቦተ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ከመ፡ ይኩኖ፡ መርሀ፡ ለመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፨ በዘመነ፡ ሲመቱ፡ ለተስፋ፡ ሚካካኤል[sic]፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም። አሜን፨
additional.tran: Fol. 79vb: Who who donated it to the church of St. George so that it might be his guide to the Kingdom of Heaven. During the time of Täsfa Mikaˀel’s office.
additional.det: The donor is not mentioned, but it appears that the note refers to the name Wäldä Śǝllase mentioned in the concluding supplication. Besides, the note mentions Täsfa Mikaʾel, the head of St. George’s church. It is written in a secondary hand, the same which inserted the names of the donors in the supplication formulas.

extras.extra: - Writing exercises, doodles: the front board, 2r, 66r, 67r, 79v, 80v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Daily readings are indicated by the names of the days written in the upper margins of fols: 13ra, 22vb, 30rb, 36ra, 43ra, 50vb, 58va, 62ra, 62vb, 64rb, 65ra, 66ra, 66vb, 68ra.

miniature.info: Fol. 1v: St. George slaying the dragon.
miniature.details: Legend: ቅዱስ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ምስለ፡ ፈረሱ “St. George with his horse”; ደራጎ “Dragon”; ገበል “Snake”. The legend is written in purple ink.
Legends: ጌታ ፈጣሪ “The Lord Creator”; ማርያም “Mary”; ጸሃይ “Sun”; ወርህ “Moon”. The legend is written in purple ink.

miniature.info: Fol. 2v: Bishop blessing a man and a woman (possibly the donors).
miniature.details: Legend: ጳጳስ፡ ምህ<…> “Bishop Mǝh<…> ” The legend is written in purple ink.

miniature.info: Fol. 79vb: The donor with the book on a pulpit.
Fol. 80r: Virgin Mary with her Child, a prone figure below (the donor?).
miniature.details: Legends: ምስ[ለ]፡ ፍቁራ፡ ወልዳ “With her beloved Child”; ዘከመ፡ ተማኅፀነ፡ መዝገ[በ]፡ ሥላሴ፡ ምስለ፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ሃይማኖት “How Mäzgäbä Śǝllase entrusted himself together with his wife Haymanot” (not present in this miniature). The legends are written in purple ink.

miniature.info: Fol. 80v: Two female figures (the donor and her maid?).
miniature.details: Legends: ዘከመ፡ ተማኅፀነት፡ ወለተ፡ ተክለ፡ ሃይማኖት “How Wälättä Täklä Haymanot entrusted herself”; ወይዘሮ “Lady”; ወለተ፡ ማርያም “Wälättä Maryam” The legends are written in black and purple ink.
